block.p: LEAD: The New York City Department of Health last week released a list of 22 food establishments cited for violating the health code.
LEAD: The New York City Department of Health last week released a list of 22 food establishments cited for violating the health code.
The New York City Department of Health last week released a list of 22 food establishments cited for violating the health code.
In addition, it listed nine that were allowed to reopen after correcting earlier violations.
The establishments are these: VIOLATIONS MANHATTAN Area Code 212 Deli, 621 Hudson St. (12th St.).

Some food uncovered, no operating permit, mouse droppings. Cafe Roma, 385 Broome St. (Mott St.). Mouse droppings, dead mouse, gas hot water heater vented improperly, doors and wall exhaust fan not secure against rodents, loose boards in basement floor. Eduardo's Cocktail Lounge, 1140 2d Ave. (60th St.) No protection certificate, mouse droppings. Juan's Restaurant, 256 10th Ave. (24th St.). No operating permit, flies, no current extermination report, dirt at wall-floor junction. Live Bait, 14 E. 23d St. No operating permit, material stored on floor. No. 1 Son Noodle Shoppe, 496 La Guardia Place (W. Houston St.). Grease on kitchen floor, mouse droppings. Orloff's, 1900 Broadway (63d St.). No operating permit, no chemical test kit for low-temperature dishwasher, mouse droppings, roaches, flies, dirt, old food and holes at wall-floor junctions, holes in basement wall, tiles missing from kitchen and basement ceiling, refrigerator shelves corroded, seams in kitchen cuting board, old food on can opener, water on bottom shelves of refrigerator, boxes stored on floor, no thermometer in service counter refrigerators, standing water on basement floor, kitchen sink leaks. Popeye's, 125 W. 42d St. Holes in basement ceiling, standing water in walk-in refrigerator, old food on floor, some material stored improperly, mouse droppings. Ronzzo Pizza, 471 Lenox Ave. (133d St.). No sign warning employees to wash hands, no soap or paper towels in employees' bathroom, mouse droppings, no protection certificate, no operating permit, no extermination report. BRONX Caserta Restaurant, 1318 E. Gun Hill Road (Burke Ave.). Mouse droppings, hole in kitchen floor, material stored on kitchen floor, open space above kitchen fan. Original Diana's Pizza, 2309 Grand Concourse (E. 183d St.). Mouse droppings, dead mice, basement door and window not secure against rodents. Pizza House, 945 E. 163d St. (Intervale Ave.).

No operating permit, no ceiling panel over walk-in refrigerator and bathroom, no guard on fan in walk-in refrigerator, old syrup on soda machine nozzle. BROOKLYN Church's Fried Chicken, 2596 Linden Blvd. (Pine St.). Mouse droppings, food handlers not wearing nets, back door not secure against rodents, grease and dirt at wall-floor junctions, no self-inspection records. Kwong Fat Restaurant, 867 Flatbush Ave. (Martense St.). Mouse droppings, kitchen not secure against rodents. Pedro's Place, 104 Front St. (Washington St.).

Some foods stored at improper temperatures. QUEENS Burger King, 31-24 Steinway St. Holes in ceiling and basement walls, flies. Burger King, 220-02 Jamaica Ave. Holes in basement wall, standing water near carbon dioxide containers, old food on basement stairs, roaches. Queens Coffee Shop, 108-80 Roosevelt Ave. No chemical test kit for low-temperature dishwasher, hole in ceiling, dirt and grease on floor, no protection certificate, some food left uncovered, no individual towels for washing hands in bathroom, dust on refrigerator fan guards. Soul Food, 109-10 Guy R. Brewer Blvd. No operating permit. Woodside Steak House, 61-02 Roosevelt Ave.

Mouse droppings, dirt on basement floor, seams in kitchen cutting board, some food uncovered in refrigerator, standing water on basement floor. STATEN ISLAND Dunkin Donuts, 1351 Forest Ave. Mouse droppings, roaches, no extermination report, no chemical test kit for low-temperature dishwasher, old food on storage room floor, hole in office wall. Shao's Palace, 2003 Victory Blvd. Mouse droppings, roach egg cases. Reopened MANHATTAN Cadillac Bar, 15 W. 21st St. Keban-N-Kebab's, 148 W. 4th St. BROOKLYN Camille's, 311 Henry St. (Atlantic Ave.) Chi Chi's, 5210 Kings Plaza (Rochester Ave.) International Restaurant, 131 Tompkins Ave. (Vernon Ave.) La Banquet, 3405 Church Ave. (E. 34th St.) Lavyan Restaurant, 1619 Ave. M (E. 16th St.) STATEN ISLAND Cardini's, 142 Dongan St. Frank's Luncheonette, 7001A Amboy Road
